skill.name: Agent Development
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user asks to "create an agent", "add an agent", "write a subagent", "agent frontmatter", "when to use description", "agent examples", "agent tools", "agent colors", "autonomous agent", or needs guidance on agent structure, system prompts, triggering conditions, or agent development best practices for Claude Code plugins.

security_audit.summary: Official skill with documentation and a local validation script. Minimal audit performed per policy. No security issues found.

content.value_statement: You need reliable rules for agent files and triggering. This skill provides templates, examples, and validation guidance to create consistent agents.
actual_capabilities: Explains required agent frontmatter fields and constraints
Provides structured system prompt templates for agents
Documents triggering example formats with commentary guidance
Offers an AI assisted agent creation prompt workflow
Includes a shell script to validate agent markdown files
limitations: Does not create or edit agent files for you
Does not run agents or verify triggering at runtime
Does not integrate with external repositories or APIs
Does not manage plugin packaging or releases

use_cases.title: Create a new agent file
use_cases.description: Build a complete agent file with correct frontmatter, triggering examples, and a structured system prompt.

use_cases.title: Standardize agent rules
use_cases.description: Align agent naming, descriptions, tool access, and validation steps across a team.

use_cases.title: Draft triggering examples
use_cases.description: Write clear example blocks that explain when and why an agent should trigger.

prompt_templates.title: Minimal agent template
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a starter agent file
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a minimal agent markdown template with required frontmatter fields and a short system prompt outline.

prompt_templates.title: Trigger examples
prompt_templates.prompt: Write two example blocks for a documentation agent with context, user text, assistant response, and commentary.

prompt_templates.title: System prompt plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a system prompt for a test generation agent with responsibilities, process steps, quality standards, and output format.

prompt_templates.title: Full JSON spec
prompt_templates.prompt: Return JSON with identifier, whenToUse, and systemPrompt fields, each with a short example value.

output_examples.input: List the required frontmatter fields for a Claude Code agent.
output: Name is required and uses lowercase with hyphens
Description must include triggering conditions and examples
Model must be inherit, sonnet, opus, or haiku
Color must be one of the supported UI colors
Tools are optional and should follow least privilege

best_practices: Include two to four triggering examples with clear commentary
Write system prompts in second person with defined output format
Validate agent files with the script before testing triggers
anti_patterns: Granting unnecessary tool access by default
Omitting process steps or output format in system prompts

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance targets Claude Code agents and fits Claude and Codex workflows.

faq.question: What are the limits of the validation script?
faq.answer: It checks file structure and fields only. It does not test runtime behavior or triggering.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my plugin?
faq.answer: Create agent files in your plugin agents directory and validate them with the script.

faq.question: Does this skill handle data safety?
faq.answer: No. It provides best practices, but you must apply your own data handling policies.

faq.question: What if my agent does not trigger?
faq.answer: Add more examples, refine commentary, and match real user phrasing in the description.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic prompt guides?
faq.answer: It is specific to Claude Code agent files, frontmatter rules, and triggering examples.
